conclusion: Understanding Faraday's Law and its application to induced EMF.
Magnetic flux through the loop is expressed as Φ_B = B · A.
Area of the loop when subtending 90° is A = πR²/4.
Rate of change of magnetic flux is related to the changing area of the loop.
Change in area with respect to time is dA/dt = πR²/4.
Induced EMF is calculated as EMF = -B × (πR²/4).
Potential difference V_ab between points a and b is V_ab = B(πR²/4).
